alert.note: Alert for Bennett; Mellette; Todd; Tripp (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 5:06PM MST until February 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...WIDESPREAD HEAVY SNOW AND DANGEROUSLY COLD TEMPERATURES EXPECTED... .Late tonight into early tomorrow, the first of two rounds of snow is expected to impact the area, primarily affecting far northwestern South Dakota and higher elevations of the northern of central Black Hills. More widespread heavy snow arrives late Tuesday into Wednesday, with several inches of snow expected area- wide. The combination of heavy snow and breezy winds will lead to dangerous or impossible travel conditions across northeastern Wyoming and western South Dakota through early Thursday. Dangerously cold Arctic air will accompany the snow, with wind chills as low as 30 to 40 below zero expected across the area Wednesday morning through at least Thursday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM MST /9 PM CST/ TUESDAY TO 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 14 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Bennett County, Mellette County, Todd County and Tripp County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Rosebud Reservation. * WHEN...From 8 PM MST /9 PM CST/ Tuesday to 11 AM MST /noon CST/ Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes beginning Wednesday.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected. This will create dangerous conditions. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
